medium:
Tz'u-chou ware
Stoneware with painted decoration on white slip under a clear glaze
title: Pillow
text: Painting directly on white slip was one of several decorative techniques practiced at Tz'u-chou kilns. This pillow features a deer painted in its main register. The animal was an auspicious emblem connoting a wish for long life to Taoists and the hope for official title to Confucian scholars. A variety of auspicious animals and flowers were common decoration on painted Tz'u-chou pillows.
description: ceramic pillow with painted glaze decoration in black of deer profile and foliage on top; scroll designs on outer edges; white glaze
creditline: Gift of Eskenazi Ltd., London, in honour of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
